questions.text: Which of the following statement about techniques of autopsy is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: In Virchow technique organs are removed one by one.

options.label: B
options.text: Ghon is an autopsy technique used for Pediatric autopsies.

options.label: C
options.text: Letulle technique is the best to preserve vascular supply.

options.label: D
options.text: In situ dissection combinedwith en bloc removal is done in Rokitansky autopsy.

questions.correct_answer: B. Ghon is an autopsy technique used for Pediatric autopsies.

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman's eyes are itchy and dry. The discomfort is modest in the morning but becomes more severe over the day. Her eyes feel gritty, she says, especially when she's in a place with air conditioning. A Schirmer's test revealed that the filter paper had 7 mm of moisture on it. What is the ONE MOST APPROPRIATE management technique? (More than 10 mm of moisture on the filter paper is considered a normalSchirmer's test.)

A 32-year-old lady has been experiencing dull pain in her right eye for the past week, which gets worse when she moves her eye. Her medical history includes a diagnosis of multiple sclerosis six months ago. A pallor of the optic disc seen on an opthalmoscopy. Which part of the body is most likely to be impacted?

For the past 24 hours, a 34-year-old guy has had an acutely painful, red right eye. His vision is blurry, he says. He has a history of cervical spondylitis and has been using diclofenac for back pain and stiffness for the past four years. His pupil is irregular in shape and he is light sensitive, according to the examination. What is the ONE clinical diagnosis that is most likely?
A 45 year old man with type 1 diabetes mellitus has his annual checkups. Dot and blot haemorrhage with hard exudates are visible on ophthalmoscopy. What is the ONE MOST LIKELY DISEASE?
Which is the most reliable and specific test for detection of blood stain?

A 52-year-old guy appears with full visual loss in his right eye. He'd also been complaining of right-sided migraines that worsened when he chewed. The retina appeared pale on fundoscopy, and a cherry red patch could be detected in the macular region.What is the MOST LIKELY CAUSE OF VISIONLOSS?

At her local optician, a 45-year-old woman had her visual acuity evaluated. She arrives at the emergency department with acute ocular pain and redness several hours later. She also sees coloured halos, according to her. What is the most likely anatomical structure to be involved?

Which of the following statements are True regarding tests for detection of sperm or seminal fluid? a) Barberio’s test detects the presence of spermine which is one of the constituents of semen. b) Florence test detects old seminal stain. c) Identification of atleast one unbroken sperm is the most conclusive test for semen detection. d) Monoclonal Antibody Mouse Antihuman Semen- 5 (MHS-5) detects the presence of specific and unique seminal plasma markers.

Over the nasal end of his right lower eyelid, a 40-year-old man experiences pain, redness, and swelling. The eye watery, and there is a purulent discharge. The nasal peri-orbital area is reddened, and mucoid discharge can be seen from the lacrimal punctum. What is the ONE clinical diagnosis that is most appropriate?
Amongst the options listed, which of the following is NOT an example of grievous injury under section 320 IPC?

options.label: B
options.text: Permanent loss of hearing from one ear

questions.text: A 33-year-old woman started seeing little black dots a few hours ago, followed by a painless loss of vision in her left eye. It felt like a curtain was falling down at first, she adds. The optic disc seems normal on fundoscopy. What is the MOST LIKELY UNDERLYINGPATHOLOGY?
Which of the following is Not an early change seen in the first 12 to 24 hours of death?
questions.explanation:
Changes after death
Immediate changes Early changes Late changes
Insensibility Post-mortem cooling Putrefaction
Respiratory arrest Eye changes Adipocere formation
Circulatory arrest Skin changes Mummification
Post-mortem
Lividity Skeletonisation
Muscle changes

questions.text: Match the following i) Cardiotoxic poison a) Sulfuric acid ii) Neurotoxic Poison b) Hydrogen sulfide iii) Asphyxiants c) Digitalis iv) Corrosive d) Datura

options.label: A
options.text: i d, ii c, iii b, iv a

options.label: B
options.text: i c, ii d, iii b, iv a

options.label: C
options.text: i d, ii c, ii a, iv b

options.label: D
options.text: i c, ii a, iii b, iv d

questions.correct_answer: B. i c, ii d, iii b, iv a
questions.explanation:
Poison Toxin Venom
Any Substance in any form (Solid, Liquid, gas) given through any route (topical, injected) which causes ill effects/death though its local/remote actions Any Substance produced by living organism (bacterial, virus, animal) Variety of toxins

Stimulation

↓

Deliriants

Depress

↓

Somniferous

Intoxication

Eg.Datura, Cocaine, Cannabis Eg. Opiods Eg. Alcohol

questions.text: A 30 year old woman, G3,P1, A 1, presents to the emergency department with abdominal pain and heavy vaginal bleeding that began suddenly an hour ago. The patient’s 18 week ultrasound revealed a singleton intrauterine pregnancy with a posterior placenta. The patient also reported a history of chronic hypertension and states she has not been compliant with the medication. On abdominal examination, a firm, tender and gravid uterus is appreciated. Speculum examination shows 50 mL of clotted blood in the vagina and continued heavy bleeding. The cervix is 4 cm dilated and 80% effaced, with the fetal head at 0 station. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's presentation?

A 40-year-old woman, G1,P1 , presents with the complaints of persistent vaginal spotting and lower abdominal pain. She had an uncomplicated vaginal delivery 4 months ago. Since then, she has had bloody discharge of decreasing volume that has not completely resolved. The abdominal pain has been mild but constant.Abdominal examination reveals mild lower abdominal tenderness to deep palpation but no masses, rebound, or guarding. Speculum examination shows a dark, irregular 2-cm lesion on the posterior fornix that bleeds after contact with an applicator, with scant blood in the vaginal vault. A urine pregnancy test is positive. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?
In which obstetrical condition is hCG level expected to decrease?

A 22-year-old woman complains of fever and abdominal pain. She gives a history of medical termination of pregnancy in a rural health center. She has symptoms of increasingly purulent vaginal discharge, bleeding, and intermittent headaches for the last 3 days. Her vitals are- Temperature is 39 C (102.2 F), blood pressure is 93/52 mm Hg, pulse is 120/min, and respirations are 18/min. Abdominal palpation shows bilateral lower quadrant tenderness but no masses, rebound, or guarding. Purulent cervical discharge is noted on speculum examination. Bedside ultrasound reveals a 2×2 cm (0.8×0.8 in) echogenic mass in the endometrial cavity near the uterine fundus. A urine pregnancy test is positive. Which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Give antibiotics and perform suction curettage

options.label: B
options.text: Give intravenous fluid, analgesics and advise bed rest

options.label: D
options.text: Give misoprostol and reassure the patient

questions.correct_answer: A. Give antibiotics and perform suction curettage

questions.text: Which of the following statements about physiological changes in pregnancy is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Colostrum starts to get secreted from end of second trimester & beginning of third trimester & can be expressed by gentle massage.

options.label: B
options.text: The mean arterial pressure and the peripheral resistance drops in pregnancy.

options.label: C
options.text: There is an increase in blood volume but overall decrease in red blood cell concentration.

options.label: D
options.text: In pregnancy, there is decrease in concentration of most of the clotting factors.

questions.correct_answer: D. In pregnancy, there is decrease in concentration of most of the clotting factors.
questions.explanation:
Decrease in

Red cell concentration

Hb concentration

Hematocrit

Plasma folate concentration

Increase in

White cell count

ESR

Fibrinogen concentration

questions.text: Which of the following birth defect is NOT expected in fetal alcohol syndrome?

A 28 year old woman , G1, P1, comes for her routine prenatal visit at 28 weeks. She has been diagnosed with HIV 5 years back and is compliant with her ART. Which of the following statement is NOT correct regarding HIV in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: There is always a benefit of cesarean section over normal vaginal delivery in decreasing the transmission of HIV to fetus in pregnancy.

options.label: B
options.text: Oral ART during pregnancy + IV Zidovudine during labor can reduce mother to child transmission to < 2%

options.label: C
options.text: Full dose of Ritonavir is contraindicated in pregnancy due to its toxicity.

options.label: D
options.text: PPH in woman with HIV is best managed with oxytocin and prostaglandin analogues and ergot alkaloids like methergine are avoided due to their unwanted interactions with ART drugs.

questions.correct_answer: A. There is always a benefit of cesarean section over normal vaginal delivery in decreasing the transmission of HIV to fetus in pregnancy.

questions.text: Two weeks ago, a 60-year-old man suffered a myocardial infarction. Dyspnoea and pleuritic chest discomfort are now his symptoms. On investigation, a pericardial friction rub was discovered. The electrocardiogram (ECG) reveals broad ST elevation. An enlarged, globular heart can be seen on a chest x-ray. His heart rate is 95 beats per minute, and he takes 24 breaths each minute. What is the MOST LIKELY REASON for his symptoms?
questions.explanation:
Early Pericarditis Late Pericarditis (Dressler’s Syndrome)
  • 10% of patients with acute Ml.
  • Risk factors: Transmural Ml
  • Symptoms: Worsening of pain while supine, radiation of pain to the trapezius ridge.
  • Physical exam: Pericardial friction rub.
  • Diagnosis: ECG may show evidence of pericarditis; echo may show pericardial effusion
  • Treatment: Aspirin.Avoid NSAIDs and corticosteroids (may interfere with healing of infarcted myocardium)
  • 1-3% of patients with acute Ml. secondary to immune-medicated injury.
  • Timing: Usually occurs 1-8 weeks after Ml.
  • Physical exam: Pericardial rub, fever.
  • Diagnosis: ECG may show evidence of pericarditis; echo may show pericardial effusion
  • Treatment: Aspirin.
  • If > 4 weeks since Ml, can use NSAIDs or corticosteroids

questions.text: Pre-operatively for an elective osteoarthritic knee replacement, a 62-year-old man receives a routine ECG. The WRS complex is not extended, and he is in sinus rhythm. The PR interval gradually lengthens, followed by a dropped beat per 3 or 4 QRS complexes. The PR interval cannot be calculated by the ECG equipment. There are no palpitations reported by the patient. What is the ONE MOST LIKELY DISEASE?

A 45-year-old woman is taken to the hospital with dyspnea, palpitations, and a history of two episodes of syncope in the previous two days. She admits to having trouble breathing when she sits erect after additional inquiry. When she rests flat on her couch, she feels a great sense of relief. The tips of her fingers are blue, and she has clubbing, according to the examination. Auscultation indicates a mid-diastolic rumbling that changes with the patient's position, as well as a loud S1 at the apex of the heart. What is the ONE MOST LIKELY DISEASE?

Since childhood, a 22-year-old male athlete has suffered from regular fainting bouts. He has no history of sudden death or arrhythmias in his family. His ECG shows a sinus rhythm with normal P-R and QRS intervals but an abnormally lengthy QT interval. What's the reason behind his passing out?

For the past two weeks, a 56-year-old man has felt a weird tingling around his mouth. It was initially extremely faint, but it has become increasingly evident. Twitching facial muscles were discovered throughout the examination. Type 1 diabetes has been a part of his medical history. What is the MOST LIKELY biochemical finding?

An 18 year old female presents with the complaint of not having menstrual periods since 3 months. Menarche was at the age of 13 years and her menstrual cycle lasts 30 days with 4-5 days of menstrual bleeding. She has experienced no changes in appetite, weight and has no chronic medical condition. The patient is a runner and trains everyday for 4 hours for an upcoming state level competition. Her vitals are in the normal range, BMI is 18 kg/m 2 and physical examination is unremarkable. What is the most probable cause for this patient’s amenorrhea?

A 30-year-old lady complains of weight gain and diminished appetite. In the previous ten months, she's had irregular, infrequent periods. She is also fatigued and sluggish for the majority of the day. Her skin appears to be dry and coarse. What is the ONE MOST LIKELY DISEASE?

A 40-year-old man has been feeling fatigued, weak, and suffering from headaches. His blood pressure is 210/100 millimetres of mercury. He isn't on any kind of medication. His blood tests revealed the following: Haemoglobin 130 g/L Serum sodium 144 mmol/L Serum potassium 2.9 mmol/L What is the SINGLE most likely diagnosis?

A persistent alcoholic of 55 years stopped consuming alcohol four days ago. For the past 6 years, he has consumed approximately 5 cans of beer per day. He's been feeling nauseous and vomiting many times a day since stopping. He reports normal-colored faeces and no blood in his vomitus. Sweating, palpitations, and tremors are all things he rejects. What is the ONE electrolyte problem that is most likely?

A 32-year-old woman complains of a thin, gray foul smelling vaginal discharge is present, but no vesicles, ulcers, or other lesions are seen.Microscopy of the vaginal fluid shows epithelial cells that have a stippled appearance. Urine dipstick test is negative for protein and glucose. What is the treatment of choice for this patient?
questions.explanation:
ACIDIC PH

 ALKALINE pH > 4.5
CANDIDIASIS Bacterial Vaginosis Trichomoniasis
  • DIMORPHIC FUNGI Blastospores [Spreads] Mycelia [lnvasion & adherence]
  • Curdy white discharge, plaque on vaginal wall on removal causes Petechiae
  • Out of proportion PRURITIS
  • Complicated / uncomplicated

Uncomplicated

  • seen in & women
  • Good prognosis
  • a/w albicans
  • Hemophilus vaginalis aka Gardenella vaginalis
  • Creamy discharge
  • WHIFT TEST → +ve
    • Secretion + 10% KOH → amines
    • Fishy odour
  • CLUE CELLS - vaginal epithelium with embeded bacteria·

  • NO PRURITIS
  • TREATMENT
    • METRONIDAZOLE
    • Rx the Women [no sexual transmission]
  • by Trichomonas vaginalis Flagellate protozoan Motile organism cause severe irritation & severe pruritis
  • COLPITIS MACULARIS [STRAWBERRY VAGINA]
  • Greenish yellow,
  • Froathy discharge
  • TREATMENT
    • METRONIDAZOLE
    • Rx both man & women

questions.text: Double vision is present in a 43-year-old smoker. She gets tired quickly, has trouble ascending stairs, and has trouble reaching for goods on shelves. Reflexes are lacking on assessment but are elicited following exercise. After repeated testing, the shoulder abduction power has increased to 4+/5 from 3/5. What is the MOST LIKELY PATHOLOGY for this patient's condition?
A 45-year-old chronic drinker with an ataxic gait, hallucinations, and confusion presents to A&E. Chlordiazepoxide is given to him. What is the drug that should be taken with chlordiazepoxide?
Which of the following statement is incorrect about Intra Uterine Contraceptive Devices?

options.label: A
options.text: Copper containing IUCDs cause aseptic Inflammation of endometrium causing reduced chance of implantation.

options.label: B
options.text: Levonorgestrel containing IUDs can be used for 5 years and is useful contraception in patients suffering from menorrhagia.

options.label: C
options.text: IUCDs can be safely used in uterine anomalies

options.label: D
options.text: Pain is a common side effect with IUCD use.

questions.correct_answer: C. IUCDs can be safely used in uterine anomalies

questions.text: A 81-year-old man is brought to the clinic by his son, who is concerned that his father is not himself. He has been depressed since his wife died three years ago. His father has become increasingly forgetful, according to his son, leaving taps running or the stove on when not in use. He can't always speak what he wants to convey and is easily confused. Mild, diffuse cortical atrophy is visible on a CT scan of the brain. Which of the following medications is most likely to be started first?

Over the previous year, a 69-year-old man's balance had deteriorated and he was having difficulties walking. He has been falling more regularly recently, and his wife has noticed that he forgets to turn off the stove or the water faucets. Urinary urgency and incontinence have also become a problem for him. He walks with a cane and has trouble turning during the inspection. What is the ONE MOST LIKELY DISEASE?

Police discovered a 26-year-old male on the street who was unsteady and drunk. He got a sudden onset of severe headache when he was admitted to Emergency. The headache is persistent and restricted to his occipital region. His GCS is 15/15, he is afebrile, and he has no focal neurological symptoms on examination. What is the ONE MOST LIKELY DISEASE?

A 40-year-old woman, gravida 7 para 7, underwent a vacuum-assisted vaginal delivery 30 minutes ago for fetal heart rate abnormalities of a 4.1-kg (9-lb) infant. The placenta delivered spontaneously and was intact on inspection with an estimated blood loss of 500 ml. The patient has now heavy vaginal bleeding with large blood clots.On abdominal examination, the uterine fundus is soft and palpated 3 cm above the umbilicus.Which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Perform uterine massage and administer oxytocin

questions.correct_answer: B. Perform uterine massage and administer oxytocin

questions.text: A 47-year-old diabetic woman presents to the hospital with facial asymmetry. With dribbling, the right hand corner of her mouth began to droop this morning. She suffered soreness behind her right ear the day before yesterday, but there were no visible rashes. Her right eye is likewise dry, according to her. She is unable to move her right side of her face or raise her right eyebrow during the test. What is the ONE MOST LIKELY DISEASE?

A 29-year-old woman was admitted with a fever, rigours, and pain in her right loin. Blood, leukocyte esterase, and nitrites were detected in a dipstick urine. A midstream urine sample (MSU) has been sent for culture. She has no significant medical history. What is the single appropriate course of action?

options.label: B
options.text: Wait for culture results to start antibiotics

options.label: D
options.text: Ultrasound and X-ray of kidney, ureter and bladder

questions.text: A 28-year-old at 12 weeks of gestation is diagnosed with complete hydatidiform mole. Which of the following statements about complete hydatidiform mole are correct? Fetal parts can be appreciated in complete mole. There is diffuse trophoblastic hyperplasia and chorionic villi swelling. Chances of choriocarcinoma is lesser as compared to partial mole. With complete mole, theca lutein cysts can be appreciated. After suction curettage of complete mole, patient is advised not to plan for a pregnancy for the next 6 months.
questions.explanation:
Partial Mole Complete Mole
  • Fetus present
  • Focal Trophoblastichyperplasia
  • Focal Chorionic villi swelling
  • Scalloping a villi +nt
  • Trophoblasticstromal Inclusion +nt
  • Chance a Choriocarcinoma is 2-4/.
  • No fetus
  • Diffuse Trophoblastichyperplasia
  • Diffuse chorionic villi swelling
  • Scalloping a villi absent
  • Trophoblastic stromal inclusion -nt
  • Chance a Choriocarcinoma is 20%

questions.text: A 32-year-old guy has painless haematuria and pain in his flanks. His blood pressure is 155/98 millimetres of mercury. The rest of the medical examination was unremarkable. What is the ONE MOST LIKELY DISEASE?

A 38-year-old woman, gravida 1 para 0, comes to the emergency department at 37 weeks gestation with the complaints of fatigue, headaches, and blurred vision for the past 3 days. The patient's pregnancy has been complicated by gestational hypertension that has not required antihypertensive therapy.Blood pressure is 170/110 mm Hg and pulse is 80/min. Physical examination shows edema of the hands and face. Deep tendon reflexes are 2+. Urine dipstick shows 3+ protein. A complete blood count and liver function panel are unremarkable. A biophysical profile shows a score of 8/8 and a fetus in vertex presentation. Which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Reassure the patient, advise bed rest and analgesics

options.label: B
options.text: Add magnesium sulfate and start IV labetalol

options.label: C
options.text: Give oxytocin and deliver the baby

options.label: D
options.text: Give morphine and repeat biophysical profile.

questions.correct_answer: B. Add magnesium sulfate and start IV labetalol

questions.text: Over the previous six months, a 28-year-old type 1 diabetic has experienced occasional diarrhoea and abdominal bloating. He also complains about being exhausted all of the time. The following are the results of his blood tests: Haemoglobin 135 g/L (130-180 g/L) Ferritin 30 ng/ml (20-300 ng/ml) Thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) 2.5 mU/L (0.5-5.7 mU/L) Immunoglobulin A (IgA) tissue transglutaminase positive What is the SINGLE most appropriate next step in action?

options.label: D
options.text: Advice patients to go on a gluten-free diet

questions.text: Mucosal haemorrhage and petechial rashes affect a 12-year-old girl. She's been feeling tired recently. on examination she looks pale. A blood count reveals the following: Haemoglobin 74 g/L White cell count 1.9 x 109/L Neutrophils 0.1 x 109/L Platelets 24 x 109/L Blood film morphology was unremarkable. Reticulocytes are absent. A bone marrow aspirate shows a gross reduction in all haematopoietic tissue that is replaced by fat spaces. What is the SINGLE most likely underlying diagnosis?

Fatigue and palpitations affect a 41-year-old man. A red sore tongue, angular stomatitis, and koilonychia are discovered on physical examination. The results of his blood testing shows Haemoglobin 85 g/ Mean cell volume 75 fL What is the SINGLE most likely diagnosis?
In a patient with chronic stable angina, which medicine lowers the risk of cardiovascular death and increases life expectancy?
Which chromosome has a role in MEN1 pathogenesis?
questions.explanation:
MEN 1 11q13
MEN 2 10 ( RET proto-oncogene)
MEN 3 10 ( RET Proto-oncogene)
MEN 4 12p13

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman, gravida 1, para 1, at 29 weeks of gestation is diagnosed with gestational diabetes mellitus. Which of the following is NOT true about gestational diabetes mellitus?

options.label: A
options.text: Cardiac anomalies like transposition of great arteries is the most common newborn complication in mothers with GDM.

options.label: B
options.text: Fetal lung maturity is delayed in GDM pregnancy.

options.label: C
options.text: Baby born to mother with GDM is at risk of hyperglycemia at birth.

options.label: D
options.text: Screening of GDM is done with Glucose Challenge Test at 24 weeks and blood sugar values >140 mg/dl is confirmed with Glucose Tolerance Test.

questions.text: In which of the following heart diseases is Not a contraindication to pregnancy?

A 28-year-old woman has recently got an hCG injection for egg retrieval as part of her infertility treatment. She has developed lower abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting for the past 2 days. Urine pregnancy test is positive.Transvaginal ultrasound shows bilateral ovarian enlargement with multiple cysts measuring up to 8 x 8 cm and intraabdominal fluid consistent with ascites.Doppler shows normal blood flow to both ovaries. options.label: B

questions.text: An 8-year-old boy presents with complaints of rash, abdominal pain, and nausea. The rash appeared first 2 days ago as red, round lesions on the back of thighs which eventually grew to involve both his legs and buttocks. The boy's appetite is decreased but he has no vomiting or diarrhea.His father gave a history of an upper respiratory infection last week. His vaccinations are complete for his age and his vitals are normal. On physical examination, his abdomen is soft, nondistended, and mildly tender to palpation in the periumbilical region.A palpable purpuric, non-blanching, non-tender erythematous rash was present on the feet, legs, and buttocks. Stool guaiac is positive.Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A newborn girl is evaluated in the nursery for respiratory distress. The newborn girl developed sudden-onset tachypnea and hypoxia for which she is receiving supplemental oxygen by nasal cannula 1 hour after her birth.The infant was born to a 35-year-old woman at 39 weeks gestation via a scheduled cesarean delivery for placenta previa. Apgar scores were 7 and 8 at 1 and 5 minutes, respectively. Examination shows tachypnea, grunting, nasal flaring, and subcostal and intercostal retractions.The newborn is diagnosed with transient tachypnea of newborn (TTN). Which of the following statement is incorrect regarding the diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: TTN can cause long term complications like progressive pulmonary hypertension and heart failure

options.label: B
options.text: Delivery by cesarean section is a risk factor for TTN

options.label: C
options.text: Chest X-Ray findings can show fluid in interlobar fissures and pleural effusion

options.label: D
options.text: Its treatment is self-limiting and resolves within 48-72 hours

questions.correct_answer: A. TTN can cause long term complications like progressive pulmonary hypertension and heart failure

questions.text: Which of these is NOT an X-linked dominant disorder?

Which of the following statements are true regarding Down Syndrome? i. Most common cause of trisomy 21 is due to translocation involving chromosome 21. ii. Endocardial cushion defects in the heart and duodenal atresia are common in Down Syndrome. iii. hCG and inhibin decrease in Down Syndrome iv) iv. Increased nuchal fold thickness is the most sensitive radiological marker for Down Syndrome. v. Integrated screening including first and second trimester screening is best for screening trisomy 21.

Mother age child Risk of down syndrome
20 year 1 in 1500
40 year 1 in 30

questions.text: The mother of a 6-year-old boy complains that his child passes urine while sleeping almost every night and has never been dry during the night-time. She reports that the boy can control his urine during the daytime. His growth is along 30th percentile for both his height and weight. Which of the following is the best next step in the initial management of his primary nocturnal enuresis?

options.label: A
options.text: Recommend decreased intake of fluids and caffeine after evening along with motivational therapy

questions.explanation:
ABSORBABLE NONBASORABLE
  • Absorbed in tissues
  • Because of Enzymatic digestion or phagocytosis
  • Natural
    • Catgut
    • Chromic catgut
  • Synthetic (PVD)
    • P – Polyglycaprone / Monocryl (Polydioxanone)
    • V – Vicryl (Polyglactin)
    • D – Dexon (Polyglycolic acid)
  • Persist in tissues for indefinite period of time
  • Natural -
    • Silk
    • Linen
  • Synthetic (PEN)
    • P – Prolene, Polyster
    • E – Ethilon
    • N – Nylon
Monofilament Polyfilament
  • Single strand of fibre
  • Smooth & strong
  • ↓ chance of bacterial infection
  • Knots tied may become loose (6-8 knots)

E.g – PEN, Prolene, Ethilon, Nylon
  • Multiple strands braided together
  • Easier to handle ·
  • Knots are stable (3-4 knots)
  • ↑ risk of infection → Due to lodging of bacteria in cervices

E.g. – SLIP, Silk, Linen, Polyglycolic acid (Dexon)

Polyglycolic acid (Dexon)

  • Polymer of polyglycolic acid
  • Exhibits highest affinity for adherence to E. Coli & S. Aureus
  • Absorbed in 60-90 days Q
